column4: Aw, man.  I've got to alter grub.  This is always how I end up bricking stuff...
Hey, don't worry, we all do it :D
tmux is much better than screen, I suggest you try that :D
Every time I've tried to get it going, I haven't gotten any advantages over screen which I've got a nice screenrc for.
grep "blacklist nvidia_current" /etc/modprobe.d/*.conf -- find that line, remove it.
Maybe because that's what it took to get this mac to work back in Lucid?
Also, run "sudo nvidia-xconfig" to configure X to use the nvidia module
The file /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-local.conf contains only one line: blacklist nvidia_current
You can either delete that file, or just remove the line
Yeah, I think you can -- after that run the xconfig thingo and reboot
You should restart, or, well, you can also "sudo modprobe nvidia_current" and then startx
You and others here solved it!
lolol... That's not a major problem tho :D
No problem, glad you made it really :)
